cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.solver
Class BaseSolver

java.lang.Object
  cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.solver.BaseSolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
Solver
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlgorithmCompareSolver, MedianSolver, MultiSolver, ProblemCompareSolver, SimpleSolver
public abstract class BaseSolver
extends java.lang.Object
implements Solver

Implements some methods commonly used in solvers.

BaseSolver implements method to notify all stopConditions in solver that something happened and to found if any condition is met.

BaseSolver has default render SimpleRender (however if you add more, this one is removed, so if you want both SimpleRender and your own, add both using addRender(cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.result.render.Render).

Default Result is SimpleResult which can be overridden by setResult(cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.result.Result).

Field Detail

stopConditions

protected java.util.List<StopCondition> stopConditions
List of all stop conditions associated with this solver.

At least one must be met to stop executing optimize on algorithm/problem.

logger

protected org.apache.log4j.Logger logger
Solver logger

renders

protected java.util.List<Render> renders
List of all renders in this solver.

result

protected Result result
Result for this solver.

defaultRenders

protected java.util.List<Render> defaultRenders
List of renders used if no other renders are specified.

By default, this list contains only SimpleRender, but subclasses could modify this behaviour. For example Compare solvers could have both SimpleRender and some kind of CompareRender.

messageListeners

protected java.util.List<MessageListener> messageListeners
List of all message listeners registered to this solver.

optimize

protected ResultEntry optimize(ObjectiveProblem objectiveProblem,
                               Algorithm algorithm)
Applies one algorithm on one problem until any condition is met or exception is raised.

This method just removes code duplicities since most solvers has identical this part of solving. It is not obligatory to use this method however, change it if necessary (for example algorithm switching on simple problem).

Parameters:
objectiveProblem - problem to be solved
algorithm - algorithm to be used during solving
Returns:
result entry for this optimization

addListener

public void addListener(MessageListener messageListener)
Description copied from interface: Solver
Adds new listener to solver.

Note that all stopConditions added via Solver.addStopCondition(cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.solver.condition.StopCondition) are automatically registered as listeners so do NOT add them again.

Specified by:
addListener in interface Solver
Parameters:
messageListener - new message listener to be registered

isConditionMet

public boolean isConditionMet()
Description copied from interface: Solver
Checks if at least one condition is met. If yes, returns true, otherwise returns false.

Specified by:
isConditionMet in interface Solver
Returns:
true if at least one condition is met

addStopCondition

public void addStopCondition(StopCondition stopCondition)
Description copied from interface: Solver
Adds new stop condition to list. All stop conditions are in OR relation, eg. al least one must be met to end run cycle.

Note that stop condition is automatically registered as listener, so do NOT add it again using Solver.addListener(cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.solver.message.MessageListener)!

Specified by:
addStopCondition in interface Solver
Parameters:
stopCondition - new stop condition
